results.title: Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation in Statin Treated Patients: A Double-Blinded Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ in primary prevention with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ minimum 40 mg daily, who met the inclusion criteria (age 40-70 years, body mass index 25-35 kg m-2), were invited for a personal interview where they described their history of statin use and, if any, symptoms of @<m>DISEASE_Myalgia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D063806 @@@muscle pain@@@.

citations.NLM: Dohlmann TL, Kuhlman AB, Morville T, Dahl M, Asping M, Orlando P, Silvestri S, Tiano L, Helge JW, Dela F, Larsen S. Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation in Statin Treated Patients: A Double-Blinded Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial Antioxidants (Basel). 2022 Aug 29;11(9):. PMID: 36139772
citations.BibTeX: @article{36139772, title={Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation in Statin Treated Patients: A Double-Blinded Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial}, author={Dohlmann TL and Kuhlman AB and Morville T and Dahl M and Asping M and Orlando P and Silvestri S and Tiano L and Helge JW and Dela F and Larsen S}, journal={Antioxidants (Basel)}, volume={11}, number={9}}

results.title: Simvastatin and Muscle: Zebrafish and Chicken Show that the Benefits are not Worth the Damage
results.text_hl: Unfortunately, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ causes unwanted side effects on muscles, such as @<m>DISEASE_Myalgia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D063806 @@@soreness@@@, tiredness, or @DISEASE_Muscle_Weakness @DISEASE_MESH:D018908 @@@weakness@@@.

citations.NLM: Campos LM, Guapyassu L, Gomes C, Midlej V, Benchimol M, Mermelstein C, Costa ML. Simvastatin and Muscle: Zebrafish and Chicken Show that the Benefits are not Worth the Damage Front Cell Dev Biol. 2022;10():778901. PMID: 35359432
citations.BibTeX: @article{35359432, title={Simvastatin and Muscle: Zebrafish and Chicken Show that the Benefits are not Worth the Damage}, author={Campos LM and Guapyassu L and Gomes C and Midlej V and Benchimol M and Mermelstein C and Costa ML}, journal={Front Cell Dev Biol}, volume={10}, pages={778901}}

results.title: Safety of Concomitant Use of Tacrolimus and High-Intensity Statins in Liver and Kidney Transplant Recipients.
results.text_hl: Due to increased risk of @<m>DISEASE_Myalgia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D063806 @@@myalgia@@@ and @DISEASE_Rhabdomyolysis @DISEASE_MESH:D012206 @@@rhabdomyolysis@@@ associated with the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Cyclosporine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D016572 @@@cyclosporine@@@, use of high-intensity 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl Coenzyme A reductase inhibitors (statins) is often avoided in transplant recipients.

citations.NLM: Klein K, Klimatcheva M, Hall R, Patel R, Speeg KV, Guerrero J, Long C. Safety of Concomitant Use of Tacrolimus and High-Intensity Statins in Liver and Kidney Transplant Recipients. Prog Transplant. 2025 Sep;35(3):178-182. PMID: 40576487
citations.BibTeX: @article{40576487, title={Safety of Concomitant Use of Tacrolimus and High-Intensity Statins in Liver and Kidney Transplant Recipients.}, author={Klein K and Klimatcheva M and Hall R and Patel R and Speeg KV and Guerrero J and Long C}, journal={Prog Transplant}, volume={35}, number={3}, pages={178-182}}

results.title: Pharmacodynamic evaluation of L-carnitine and piracetam in muscle injury induced by the chronic use of simvastatin.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: Concomitant use of @CHEMICAL_Carnitine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002331 @@@L-carnitine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Piracetam @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010889 @@@piracetam@@@ might have a muscle-protective effect and protection against @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Myalgia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D063806 @@@myalgia@@@.

citations.NLM: Dezena RMB, Antunes NJ, Campos R, Ilha J, Moreno RA, Mendes GD, Rosa PCP, De Nucci G. Pharmacodynamic evaluation of L-carnitine and piracetam in muscle injury induced by the chronic use of simvastatin. Int J Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2020 Sep;58(9):482-490. PMID: 32469304
citations.BibTeX: @article{32469304, title={Pharmacodynamic evaluation of L-carnitine and piracetam in muscle injury induced by the chronic use of simvastatin.}, author={Dezena RMB and Antunes NJ and Campos R and Ilha J and Moreno RA and Mendes GD and Rosa PCP and De Nucci G}, journal={Int J Clin Pharmacol Ther}, volume={58}, number={9}, pages={482-490}}

results.title: Drug-drug-gene Interactions as Mediators of Adverse Drug Reactions to Diclofenac and Statins: A Case Report and Literature Review
results.text_hl: In that light, we present a case of a 46-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who had been experiencing @DISEASE_Liver_Failure_Acute @DISEASE_MESH:D017114 @@@acute renal and hepatic injury@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Myalgia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D063806 @@@myalgia@@@ over two years of concomitant treatment with @CHEMICAL_Diclofenac @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004008 @@@diclofenac@@@, @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@/@CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@, and several other drugs, including @CHEMICAL_Pantoprazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077402 @@@pantoprazole@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Furosemide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005665 @@@furosemide@@@.

citations.NLM: Božina N, Ganoci L, Simičević L, Gvozdanović K, Domjanović IK, Fistrek Prlić M, Križ T, Borić Bilušić A, Laganović M, Božina T. Drug-drug-gene Interactions as Mediators of Adverse Drug Reactions to Diclofenac and Statins: A Case Report and Literature Review Arh Hig Rada Toksikol. 2021 Jun 28;72(3):114-128. PMID: 34187111
citations.BibTeX: @article{34187111, title={Drug-drug-gene Interactions as Mediators of Adverse Drug Reactions to Diclofenac and Statins: A Case Report and Literature Review}, author={Božina N and Ganoci L and Simičević L and Gvozdanović K and Domjanović IK and Fistrek Prlić M and Križ T and Borić Bilušić A and Laganović M and Božina T}, journal={Arh Hig Rada Toksikol}, volume={72}, number={3}, pages={114-128}}

results.title: Adverse effects of interactions between antipsychotics and medications used in the treatment of cardiovascular disorders.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The highest number of interactions with antipsychotics was recorded among beta-blockers (n = 13, 25% of all cases), including @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@cardiac arrhythmias@@@ [@DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@ (n = 1): @CHEMICAL_Risperidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D018967 @@@risperidone@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@; @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ (n = 1): @CHEMICAL_Perphenazine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010546 @@@perphenazine@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@; @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@ventricular arrhythmias@@@: @CHEMICAL_sertindole @CHEMICAL_MESH:C066304 @@@sertindole@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ (n = 1) and @CHEMICAL_ziprasidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:C092292 @@@ziprasidone@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Sotalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013015 @@@sotalol@@@ (n = 3)] and @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ [@CHEMICAL_Chlorprothixene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002749 @@@chlorprotixene@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ (n = 2)]. 12 cases concerned statins-@<m>DISEASE_Myalgia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D063806 @@@myalgia@@@, @DISEASE_Muscular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009135 @@@myopathy@@@, or creatine kinase elevation appeared after combination of @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Haloperidol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006220 @@@haloperidol@@@ (n = 1), @CHEMICAL_Quetiapine_Fumarate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069348 @@@quetiapine@@@ (n = 3) or @CHEMICAL_Risperidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D018967 @@@risperidone@@@ (n = 1), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Quetiapine_Fumarate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069348 @@@quetiapine@@@ (n = 5) or @CHEMICAL_Risperidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D018967 @@@risperidone@@@ (n = 2).

citations.NLM: Siwek M, Woroń J, Gorostowicz A, Wordliczek J. Adverse effects of interactions between antipsychotics and medications used in the treatment of cardiovascular disorders. Pharmacol Rep. 2020 Apr;72(2):350-359. PMID: 32124390
citations.BibTeX: @article{32124390, title={Adverse effects of interactions between antipsychotics and medications used in the treatment of cardiovascular disorders.}, author={Siwek M and Woroń J and Gorostowicz A and Wordliczek J}, journal={Pharmacol Rep}, volume={72}, number={2}, pages={350-359}}

results.title: Should anyone still be taking simvastatin 80 mg?
results.text_hl: A 64-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who previously suffered @<m>DISEASE_Myalgia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D063806 @@@myalgia@@@ with lower dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ was given just one high dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and developed @DISEASE_Rhabdomyolysis @DISEASE_MESH:D012206 @@@rhabdomyolysis@@@.

citations.NLM: Tayal U, Carroll R. Should anyone still be taking simvastatin 80 mg? BMJ Case Rep. 2013 Aug 8;2013():. PMID: 23929614
